message.content: A merism is a figure of speech where a whole is described by listing its parts or, conversely, a part is used to describe the whole. It can be employed in literature and poetry for emphasis or as a metaphor. For example, "from dusk till dawn" means from the beginning (dusk) to the end (dawn) of the nighttime period; another example would be "young and old," which collectively describes a wide range of ages.
